title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Department contacted me if I am interested in the job. I was interviewed by the supervisor on a zoom meeting where we talked about my research interests and job responsibilities. Then I accepted their offer.
Interview Questions: What are your research interests? Talk about work ethics, and time management.

title: Customer Service Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce
Interview Descriptions:
Went through a virtual interview first and then was invited for an in-person interview.

The overall interview was very positive. They were very welcoming from the beginning to end.

The interviewer was very responsive throughout the process.
Interview Questions: Based on your experience, what qualities can you bring to the position?

title: Student Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce (Commerce, TX) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was really laid back, I was contacted via email by the interviewee because a professor had recommended me for the position. You can tutor any class you've taken as long as you got an A in it.
Interview Questions: What classes are you comfortable tutoring?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview. minimum five people will participate in interview. they will ask HR questions and technical related Questions. There will be one interview round and if you select will contact you
Interview Questions: Previous job experience and technical related

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce (Dallas, TX) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: easy smooth and good. tell me about yourself?  what did you study? what are you studying now? can you do data? analytics or marketing. i was open i talked about what i did in the  past that can contribute to them
Interview Questions:
tell me about yourself?
i was open i talked about what i did in the  past that can contribute to them

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce
Interview Descriptions: 2 days of interviews, covered hotel and food. Candidate met with students, faculty, staff in groups and then supervisor. Met with students over lunch. Did a presentation specific to a group of folks with whom the candidate would work.

title: Web Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was conducted by my team leader.
He took 3 rounds of interview, 2 were technical with code challenge, 1 was a general topic quesitons.
After completing my interview process he introduced his manager and team people
Interview Questions: Which framework of javascript you  worked on

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce (Commerce, TX) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: My employer was very friendly and i immediately felt very comfortable. The regular tell me about yourself question was asked and talk about work experience that relate to the job role. The questions were very direct.
Interview Questions: What attracted you to this job position

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce (Commerce, TX) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had to apply through a site called handshake. You will get contacted in a couple of days for an interview. They will send you an email with the date and location.

title: Business Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce (Commerce, TX) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: It hardly takes them to decide to select a candidate. The interviewer was nice and easy going, they make you feel comfortable so you can answer them and told them about your previous work exp.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce (Commerce, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the Department Head and other 3 professors. After asking questions, I was given a research topic to work on at the library. I was nervous at first but I think it is a good part of the interview process to see if you know how to do research.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
How many more years do you have left of school?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had three professors interviewing me. I also had to do a paper at that time testing my research and writing skills. The paper had be in an APA format and they gave me an hour to write it.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you're a better fit for this job?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce (Commerce, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The Director of the TRiO programs is awesome. She can be intimidating at first but after a few minutes of talking you can really tell she is pretty laid back. 
The process was basically going over your previous experiences and schooling.
Interview Questions: What are you studying here at TAMUC?

title: Administrative Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce (Commerce, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I completed an application and I received a request for an interview about a week later. The interview was short, but informative. There were only 2 interviewers, so the it went fast.

title: Associate Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce (Commerce, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very welcoming and smooth, seemed genuinely interested in both my skills as a worker and my well being as a person joining the community. Other current employees were involved so it made the process feel more personal. I was given a great informative campus tour as well.
Interview Questions: what is your experience in fundraising?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce
Interview Descriptions: on the hiring interview for the entry level position such as student worker, don't expect much question as long as you have permit to work with paper from Financial aid that support your pay by the government. basic question, yet they will ask about your previous experiences, and they will call previous employer to make sure about your information.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce (Dallas, TX) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very casual, comfortable, and respectful. School very much wants adjuncts to come in with their own ideas about how to teach a particular subject matter. Having said all of that, I already had a relationship with the staff. So, there was a level of trust already established. Reputation has a lot to do with who they consider for adjunct positions.
Interview Questions: What are your ideas for this class?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce (Commerce, TX) in Jan 2013

title: Building Attendant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Texas A&M University-Commerce (Commerce, TX) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: The initial contact was straightforward - I was contacted because of my application and had a partial phone interview. Basically, the primary supervisor asked me a few questions about my previous jobs, what my expectations were for working there, making sure that I fit the job and the job fit me. There was only one interview with the three supervisor, primary supervisor and then the day\night leads. The interview started with ethics effectively. A rehash of the expectations. It was at this point the interviewer identified some of the harder core perceptions of the job - I would be a custodian. The people who I would be primarily surrounded with would act like I didn't exist. He advised me that there were really nice people who worked there but that the perception of the cleaning crew would be invisibility. After I was bought-in on that idea it proceeded to the technical aspects of the job, or rather, what I would have to do. Through out this phase of the interview he identified several of the tools necessary and basically "quizzed' my knowledge of the tools. After getting through that portion, he went into the nitty-gritty of the job. Overall I felt like it was a very realistic interview, I went into the job knowing exactly what would be expected of me and what I would see in return.
Interview Questions: Responding to a potential health hazard in a manner safest for everybody involved or who could potentially be involved
